channel.title: Client Run Error
channel.description:
Whenever I try to run a client (in this case a version 377 client) I end up getting this error.
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version n umber in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:12 4) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I have the the latest updates for Java (JDK1.6.0_01) (Jre1.6.0_01) but the errors remain. I used search and Google and nothing was of any help.
What is causing this error? Can someone who has a 377 client source or above take a screenshot or tell me every folder in their C:\Program Files\Java folder? I think I may be missing something.
I usually never get stumped on anything, I just can't seem to find a fix to this...

item.title: Client Run Error
item.dc:creator: @random_person random person
item.description:
@random_person wrote:

[quote=“Belthazar, post:2, topic:114776”]You need to make sure that your java coming from your compiler is going to your program files.
Make sure you have the latest java file.[/quote]

This is my compiler file:

@echo off
color 0c
title Client Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac” *.java
pause

I have Jdk1.6.0u1 however, what is the problem?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 21, 2007, 06:53:02 PM[/size][hr]Sorry to bump but I really need to know how to fix this…

Read full topic

item.title: Client Run Error
item.dc:creator: @Belthazar Belthazar
item.description:
@Belthazar wrote:

You need to make sure that your java coming from your compiler is going to your program files.
Make sure you have the latest java file.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Run Error
item.dc:creator: @random_person random person
item.description:
@random_person wrote:

Whenever I try to run a client (in this case a version 377 client) I end up getting this error.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version n umber in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:12 4) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:268) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:319) Press any key to continue . . .

What is causing this error? Can someone who has a 377 client source or above take a screenshot or tell me every folder in their C:\Program Files\Java folder? I think I may be missing something.

I usually never get stumped on anything, I just can’t seem to find a fix to this…
